text_entry: ACT I
SCENE I. London. The palace.
Enter KING HENRY, LORD JOHN OF LANCASTER, the EARL of WESTMORELAND, SIR WALTER BLUNT, and others

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: So shaken as we are, so wan with care,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Find we a time for frighted peace to pant,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: And breathe short-winded accents of new broils

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: To be commenced in strands afar remote.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: No more the thirsty entrance of this soil

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Shall daub her lips with her own childrens blood;

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Nor more shall trenching war channel her fields,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Nor bruise her flowerets with the armed hoofs

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Of hostile paces: those opposed eyes,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Which, like the meteors of a troubled heaven,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: All of one nature, of one substance bred,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Did lately meet in the intestine shock

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: And furious close of civil butchery

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Shall now, in mutual well-beseeming ranks,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: March all one way and be no more opposed

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Against acquaintance, kindred and allies:

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: The edge of war, like an ill-sheathed knife,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: No more shall cut his master. Therefore, friends,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: As far as to the sepulchre of Christ,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Whose soldier now, under whose blessed cross

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: We are impressed and engaged to fight,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Forthwith a power of English shall we levy;

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Whose arms were moulded in their mothers womb

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: To chase these pagans in those holy fields

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Over whose acres walkd those blessed feet

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Which fourteen hundred years ago were naild

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: For our advantage on the bitter cross.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: But this our purpose now is twelve month old,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: And bootless tis to tell you we will go:

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Therefore we meet not now. Then let me hear

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Of you, my gentle cousin Westmoreland,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: What yesternight our council did decree

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: In forwarding this dear expedience.

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: My liege, this haste was hot in question,

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: And many limits of the charge set down

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: But yesternight: when all athwart there came

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: A post from Wales loaden with heavy news;

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: Whose worst was, that the noble Mortimer,

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: Leading the men of Herefordshire to fight

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: Against the irregular and wild Glendower,

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: Was by the rude hands of that Welshman taken,

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: A thousand of his people butchered;

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: Upon whose dead corpse there was such misuse,

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: Such beastly shameless transformation,

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: By those Welshwomen done as may not be

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: Without much shame retold or spoken of.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: It seems then that the tidings of this broil

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Brake off our business for the Holy Land.

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: This matchd with other did, my gracious lord;

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: For more uneven and unwelcome news

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: Came from the north and thus it did import:

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: On Holy-rood day, the gallant Hotspur there,

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: Young Harry Percy and brave Archibald,

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: That ever-valiant and approved Scot,

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: At Holmedon met,

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: Where they did spend a sad and bloody hour,

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: As by discharge of their artillery,

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: And shape of likelihood, the news was told;

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: For he that brought them, in the very heat

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: And pride of their contention did take horse,

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: Uncertain of the issue any way.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Here is a dear, a true industrious friend,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Sir Walter Blunt, new lighted from his horse.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Staind with the variation of each soil

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Betwixt that Holmedon and this seat of ours;

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: And he hath brought us smooth and welcome news.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: The Earl of Douglas is discomfited:

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Ten thousand bold Scots, two and twenty knights,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Balkd in their own blood did Sir Walter see

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: On Holmedons plains. Of prisoners, Hotspur took

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Mordake the Earl of Fife, and eldest son

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: To beaten Douglas; and the Earl of Athol,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Of Murray, Angus, and Menteith:

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: And is not this an honourable spoil?

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: A gallant prize? ha, cousin, is it not?

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: In faith,

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: It is a conquest for a prince to boast of.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Yea, there thou makest me sad and makest me sin

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: In envy that my Lord Northumberland

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Should be the father to so blest a son,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: A son who is the theme of honours tongue;

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Amongst a grove, the very straightest plant;

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Who is sweet Fortunes minion and her pride:

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Whilst I, by looking on the praise of him,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: See riot and dishonour stain the brow

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Of my young Harry. O that it could be proved

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: That some night-tripping fairy had exchanged

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: In cradle-clothes our children where they lay,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: And calld mine Percy, his Plantagenet!

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Then would I have his Harry, and he mine.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: But let him from my thoughts. What think you, coz,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Of this young Percys pride? the prisoners,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Which he in this adventure hath surprised,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: To his own use he keeps; and sends me word,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: I shall have none but Mordake Earl of Fife.

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: This is his uncles teaching; this is Worcester,

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: Malevolent to you in all aspects;

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: Which makes him prune himself, and bristle up

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: The crest of youth against your dignity.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: But I have sent for him to answer this;

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: And for this cause awhile we must neglect

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Our holy purpose to Jerusalem.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Cousin, on Wednesday next our council we

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Will hold at Windsor; so inform the lords:

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: But come yourself with speed to us again;

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: For more is to be said and to be done

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Than out of anger can be uttered.

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: I will, my liege.

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: SCENE II. London. An apartment of the Princes.

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: Enter the PRINCE OF WALES and FALSTAFF

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Now, Hal, what time of day is it, lad?

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Thou art so fat-witted, with drinking of old sack

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: and unbuttoning thee after supper and sleeping upon

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: benches after noon, that thou hast forgotten to

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: demand that truly which thou wouldst truly know.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: What a devil hast thou to do with the time of the

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: day? Unless hours were cups of sack and minutes

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: capons and clocks the tongues of bawds and dials the

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: signs of leaping-houses and the blessed sun himself

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: a fair hot wench in flame-coloured taffeta, I see no

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: reason why thou shouldst be so superfluous to demand

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: the time of the day.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Indeed, you come near me now, Hal; for we that take

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: purses go by the moon and the seven stars, and not

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: by Phoebus, he,that wandering knight so fair. And,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: I prithee, sweet wag, when thou art king, as, God

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: save thy grace,--majesty I should say, for grace

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: thou wilt have none,--

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: What, none?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: No, by my troth, not so much as will serve to

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: prologue to an egg and butter.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Well, how then? come, roundly, roundly.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Marry, then, sweet wag, when thou art king, let not

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: us that are squires of the nights body be called

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: thieves of the days beauty: let us be Dianas

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: foresters, gentlemen of the shade, minions of the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: moon; and let men say we be men of good government,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: being governed, as the sea is, by our noble and

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: chaste mistress the moon, under whose countenance we steal.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Thou sayest well, and it holds well too; for the

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: fortune of us that are the moons men doth ebb and

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: flow like the sea, being governed, as the sea is,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: by the moon. As, for proof, now: a purse of gold

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: most resolutely snatched on Monday night and most

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: dissolutely spent on Tuesday morning; got with

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: swearing Lay by and spent with crying Bring in;

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: now in as low an ebb as the foot of the ladder

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: and by and by in as high a flow as the ridge of the gallows.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: By the Lord, thou sayest true, lad. And is not my

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: hostess of the tavern a most sweet wench?

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: As the honey of Hybla, my old lad of the castle. And

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: is not a buff jerkin a most sweet robe of durance?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: How now, how now, mad wag! what, in thy quips and

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: thy quiddities? what a plague have I to do with a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: buff jerkin?

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Why, what a pox have I to do with my hostess of the tavern?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Well, thou hast called her to a reckoning many a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: time and oft.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Did I ever call for thee to pay thy part?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: No; Ill give thee thy due, thou hast paid all there.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Yea, and elsewhere, so far as my coin would stretch;

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: and where it would not, I have used my credit.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Yea, and so used it that were it not here apparent

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: that thou art heir apparent--But, I prithee, sweet

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: wag, shall there be gallows standing in England when

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: thou art king? and resolution thus fobbed as it is

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: with the rusty curb of old father antic the law? Do

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: not thou, when thou art king, hang a thief.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: No; thou shalt.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Shall I? O rare! By the Lord, Ill be a brave judge.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Thou judgest false already: I mean, thou shalt have

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: the hanging of the thieves and so become a rare hangman.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Well, Hal, well; and in some sort it jumps with my

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: humour as well as waiting in the court, I can tell

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: you.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: For obtaining of suits?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Yea, for obtaining of suits, whereof the hangman

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: hath no lean wardrobe. Sblood, I am as melancholy

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: as a gib cat or a lugged bear.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Or an old lion, or a lovers lute.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Yea, or the drone of a Lincolnshire bagpipe.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: What sayest thou to a hare, or the melancholy of

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Moor-ditch?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Thou hast the most unsavoury similes and art indeed

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: the most comparative, rascalliest, sweet young

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: prince. But, Hal, I prithee, trouble me no more

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: with vanity. I would to God thou and I knew where a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: commodity of good names were to be bought. An old

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: lord of the council rated me the other day in the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: street about you, sir, but I marked him not; and yet

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: he talked very wisely, but I regarded him not; and

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: yet he talked wisely, and in the street too.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Thou didst well; for wisdom cries out in the

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: streets, and no man regards it.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: O, thou hast damnable iteration and art indeed able

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: to corrupt a saint. Thou hast done much harm upon

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: me, Hal; God forgive thee for it! Before I knew

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: thee, Hal, I knew nothing; and now am I, if a man

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: should speak truly, little better than one of the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: wicked. I must give over this life, and I will give

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: it over: by the Lord, and I do not, I am a villain:

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Ill be damned for never a kings son in

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Christendom.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Where shall we take a purse tomorrow, Jack?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Zounds, where thou wilt, lad; Ill make one; an I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: do not, call me villain and baffle me.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: I see a good amendment of life in thee; from praying

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: to purse-taking.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Why, Hal, tis my vocation, Hal; tis no sin for a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: man to labour in his vocation.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Enter POINS

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Poins! Now shall we know if Gadshill have set a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: match. O, if men were to be saved by merit, what

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: hole in hell were hot enough for him? This is the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: most omnipotent villain that ever cried Stand to

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: a true man.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Good morrow, Ned.

speaker: POINS
text_entry: Good morrow, sweet Hal. What says Monsieur Remorse?

speaker: POINS
text_entry: what says Sir John Sack and Sugar? Jack! how

speaker: POINS
text_entry: agrees the devil and thee about thy soul, that thou

speaker: POINS
text_entry: soldest him on Good-Friday last for a cup of Madeira

speaker: POINS
text_entry: and a cold capons leg?

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Sir John stands to his word, the devil shall have

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: his bargain; for he was never yet a breaker of

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: proverbs: he will give the devil his due.

speaker: POINS
text_entry: Then art thou damned for keeping thy word with the devil.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Else he had been damned for cozening the devil.

speaker: POINS
text_entry: But, my lads, my lads, to-morrow morning, by four

speaker: POINS
text_entry: oclock, early at Gadshill! there are pilgrims going

speaker: POINS
text_entry: to Canterbury with rich offerings, and traders

speaker: POINS
text_entry: riding to London with fat purses: I have vizards

speaker: POINS
text_entry: for you all; you have horses for yourselves:

speaker: POINS
text_entry: Gadshill lies to-night in Rochester: I have bespoke

speaker: POINS
text_entry: supper to-morrow night in Eastcheap: we may do it

speaker: POINS
text_entry: as secure as sleep. If you will go, I will stuff

speaker: POINS
text_entry: your purses full of crowns; if you will not, tarry

speaker: POINS
text_entry: at home and be hanged.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Hear ye, Yedward; if I tarry at home and go not,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Ill hang you for going.

speaker: POINS
text_entry: You will, chops?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Hal, wilt thou make one?

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Who, I rob? I a thief? not I, by my faith.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Theres neither honesty, manhood, nor good

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: fellowship in thee, nor thou camest not of the blood

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: royal, if thou darest not stand for ten shillings.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Well then, once in my days Ill be a madcap.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Why, thats well said.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Well, come what will, Ill tarry at home.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: By the Lord, Ill be a traitor then, when thou art king.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: I care not.

speaker: POINS
text_entry: Sir John, I prithee, leave the prince and me alone:

speaker: POINS
text_entry: I will lay him down such reasons for this adventure

speaker: POINS
text_entry: that he shall go.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Well, God give thee the spirit of persuasion and him

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: the ears of profiting, that what thou speakest may

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: move and what he hears may be believed, that the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: true prince may, for recreation sake, prove a false

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: thief; for the poor abuses of the time want

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: countenance. Farewell: you shall find me in Eastcheap.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Farewell, thou latter spring! farewell, All-hallown summer!

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Exit Falstaff

speaker: POINS
text_entry: Now, my good sweet honey lord, ride with us

speaker: POINS
text_entry: to-morrow: I have a jest to execute that I cannot

speaker: POINS
text_entry: manage alone. Falstaff, Bardolph, Peto and Gadshill

speaker: POINS
text_entry: shall rob those men that we have already waylaid:

speaker: POINS
text_entry: yourself and I will not be there; and when they

speaker: POINS
text_entry: have the booty, if you and I do not rob them, cut

speaker: POINS
text_entry: this head off from my shoulders.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: How shall we part with them in setting forth?

speaker: POINS
text_entry: Why, we will set forth before or after them, and

speaker: POINS
text_entry: appoint them a place of meeting, wherein it is at

speaker: POINS
text_entry: our pleasure to fail, and then will they adventure

speaker: POINS
text_entry: upon the exploit themselves; which they shall have

speaker: POINS
text_entry: no sooner achieved, but well set upon them.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Yea, but tis like that they will know us by our

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: horses, by our habits and by every other

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: appointment, to be ourselves.

speaker: POINS
text_entry: Tut! our horses they shall not see: Ill tie them

speaker: POINS
text_entry: in the wood; our vizards we will change after we

speaker: POINS
text_entry: leave them: and, sirrah, I have cases of buckram

speaker: POINS
text_entry: for the nonce, to immask our noted outward garments.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Yea, but I doubt they will be too hard for us.

speaker: POINS
text_entry: Well, for two of them, I know them to be as

speaker: POINS
text_entry: true-bred cowards as ever turned back; and for the

speaker: POINS
text_entry: third, if he fight longer than he sees reason, Ill

speaker: POINS
text_entry: forswear arms. The virtue of this jest will be, the

speaker: POINS
text_entry: incomprehensible lies that this same fat rogue will

speaker: POINS
text_entry: tell us when we meet at supper: how thirty, at

speaker: POINS
text_entry: least, he fought with; what wards, what blows, what

speaker: POINS
text_entry: extremities he endured; and in the reproof of this

speaker: POINS
text_entry: lies the jest.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Well, Ill go with thee: provide us all things

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: necessary and meet me to-morrow night in Eastcheap;

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: there Ill sup. Farewell.

speaker: POINS
text_entry: Farewell, my lord.

speaker: POINS
text_entry: Exit Poins

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: I know you all, and will awhile uphold

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: The unyoked humour of your idleness:

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Yet herein will I imitate the sun,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Who doth permit the base contagious clouds

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: To smother up his beauty from the world,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: That, when he please again to be himself,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Being wanted, he may be more wonderd at,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: By breaking through the foul and ugly mists

text_entry: In faith, it is exceedingly well aimd.

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: And tis no little reason bids us speed,

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: To save our heads by raising of a head;

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: For, bear ourselves as even as we can,

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: The king will always think him in our debt,

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: And think we think ourselves unsatisfied,

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: Till he hath found a time to pay us home:

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: And see already how he doth begin

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: To make us strangers to his looks of love.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: He does, he does: well be revenged on him.

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: Cousin, farewell: no further go in this

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: Than I by letters shall direct your course.

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: When time is ripe, which will be suddenly,

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: Ill steal to Glendower and Lord Mortimer;

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: Where you and Douglas and our powers at once,

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: As I will fashion it, shall happily meet,

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: To bear our fortunes in our own strong arms,

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: Which now we hold at much uncertainty.

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
text_entry: Farewell, good brother: we shall thrive, I trust.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Uncle, Adieu: O, let the hours be short

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Till fields and blows and groans applaud our sport!

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: ACT II

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: SCENE I. Rochester. An inn yard.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Enter a Carrier with a lantern in his hand

speaker: First Carrier
text_entry: Heigh-ho! an it be not four by the day, Ill be

speaker: First Carrier
text_entry: hanged: Charles wain is over the new chimney, and

speaker: First Carrier
text_entry: yet our horse not packed. What, ostler!

speaker: Ostler
text_entry: [Within]   Anon, anon.

speaker: First Carrier
text_entry: I prithee, Tom, beat Cuts saddle, put a few flocks

speaker: First Carrier
text_entry: in the point; poor jade, is wrung in the withers out

speaker: First Carrier
text_entry: of all cess.

speaker: First Carrier
text_entry: Enter another Carrier

speaker: Second Carrier
text_entry: Peas and beans are as dank here as a dog, and that

speaker: Second Carrier
text_entry: is the next way to give poor jades the bots: this

speaker: Second Carrier
text_entry: house is turned upside down since Robin Ostler died.

speaker: First Carrier
text_entry: Poor fellow, never joyed since the price of oats

speaker: First Carrier
text_entry: rose; it was the death of him.

speaker: Second Carrier
text_entry: I think this be the most villanous house in all

speaker: Second Carrier
text_entry: London road for fleas: I am stung like a tench.

speaker: First Carrier
text_entry: Like a tench! by the mass, there is neer a king

speaker: First Carrier
text_entry: christen could be better bit than I have been since

speaker: First Carrier
text_entry: the first cock.

speaker: Second Carrier
text_entry: Why, they will allow us neer a jordan, and then we

speaker: Second Carrier
text_entry: leak in your chimney; and your chamber-lie breeds

speaker: Second Carrier
text_entry: fleas like a loach.

speaker: First Carrier
text_entry: What, ostler! come away and be hanged!

speaker: Second Carrier
text_entry: I have a gammon of bacon and two razors of ginger,

speaker: Second Carrier
text_entry: to be delivered as far as Charing-cross.

speaker: First Carrier
text_entry: Gods body! the turkeys in my pannier are quite

speaker: First Carrier
text_entry: starved. What, ostler! A plague on thee! hast thou

speaker: First Carrier
text_entry: never an eye in thy head? canst not hear? An

speaker: First Carrier
text_entry: twere not as good deed as drink, to break the pate

speaker: First Carrier
text_entry: on thee, I am a very villain. Come, and be hanged!

speaker: First Carrier
text_entry: hast thou no faith in thee?

speaker: First Carrier
text_entry: Enter GADSHILL

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: Good morrow, carriers. Whats oclock?

speaker: First Carrier
text_entry: I think it be two oclock.

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: I pray thee lend me thy lantern, to see my gelding

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: in the stable.

speaker: First Carrier
text_entry: Nay, by God, soft; I know a trick worth two of that, i faith.

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: I pray thee, lend me thine.

speaker: Second Carrier
text_entry: Ay, when? canst tell? Lend me thy lantern, quoth

speaker: Second Carrier
text_entry: he? marry, Ill see thee hanged first.

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: Sirrah carrier, what time do you mean to come to London?

speaker: Second Carrier
text_entry: Time enough to go to bed with a candle, I warrant

speaker: Second Carrier
text_entry: thee. Come, neighbour Mugs, well call up the

speaker: Second Carrier
text_entry: gentleman: they will along with company, for they

speaker: Second Carrier
text_entry: have great charge.

speaker: Second Carrier
text_entry: Exeunt carriers

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: What, ho! chamberlain!

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: [Within]  At hand, quoth pick-purse.

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: Thats even as fair as--at hand, quoth the

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: chamberlain; for thou variest no more from picking

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: of purses than giving direction doth from labouring;

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: thou layest the plot how.

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: Enter Chamberlain

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Good morrow, Master Gadshill. It holds current that

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: I told you yesternight: theres a franklin in the

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: wild of Kent hath brought three hundred marks with

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: him in gold: I heard him tell it to one of his

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: company last night at supper; a kind of auditor; one

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: that hath abundance of charge too, God knows what.

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: They are up already, and call for eggs and butter;

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: they will away presently.

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: Sirrah, if they meet not with Saint Nicholas

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: clerks, Ill give thee this neck.

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: No, Ill none of it: I pray thee keep that for the

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: hangman; for I know thou worshippest St. Nicholas

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: as truly as a man of falsehood may.

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: What talkest thou to me of the hangman? if I hang,

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: Ill make a fat pair of gallows; for if I hang, old

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: Sir John hangs with me, and thou knowest he is no

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: starveling. Tut! there are other Trojans that thou

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: dreamest not of, the which for sport sake are

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: content to do the profession some grace; that would,

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: if matters should be looked into, for their own

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: credit sake, make all whole. I am joined with no

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: foot-land rakers, no long-staff sixpenny strikers,

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: none of these mad mustachio purple-hued malt-worms;

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: but with nobility and tranquillity, burgomasters and

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: great oneyers, such as can hold in, such as will

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: strike sooner than speak, and speak sooner than

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: drink, and drink sooner than pray: and yet, zounds,

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: I lie; for they pray continually to their saint, the

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: commonwealth; or rather, not pray to her, but prey

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: on her, for they ride up and down on her and make

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: her their boots.

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: What, the commonwealth their boots? will she hold

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: out water in foul way?

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: She will, she will; justice hath liquored her. We

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: steal as in a castle, cocksure; we have the receipt

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: of fern-seed, we walk invisible.

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Nay, by my faith, I think you are more beholding to

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: the night than to fern-seed for your walking invisible.

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: Give me thy hand: thou shalt have a share in our

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: purchase, as I am a true man.

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Nay, rather let me have it, as you are a false thief.

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: Go to; homo is a common name to all men. Bid the

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: ostler bring my gelding out of the stable. Farewell,

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: you muddy knave.

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: SCENE II. The highway, near Gadshill.

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: Enter PRINCE HENRY and POINS

speaker: POINS
text_entry: Come, shelter, shelter: I have removed Falstaffs

speaker: POINS
text_entry: horse, and he frets like a gummed velvet.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Stand close.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Enter FALSTAFF

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Poins! Poins, and be hanged! Poins!

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Peace, ye fat-kidneyed rascal! what a brawling dost

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: thou keep!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Wheres Poins, Hal?

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: He is walked up to the top of the hill: Ill go seek him.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: I am accursed to rob in that thiefs company: the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: rascal hath removed my horse, and tied him I know

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: not where. If I travel but four foot by the squier

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: further afoot, I shall break my wind. Well, I doubt

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: not but to die a fair death for all this, if I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: scape hanging for killing that rogue. I have

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: forsworn his company hourly any time this two and

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: twenty years, and yet I am bewitched with the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: rogues company. If the rascal hath not given me

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: medicines to make me love him, Ill be hanged; it

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: could not be else: I have drunk medicines. Poins!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Hal! a plague upon you both! Bardolph! Peto!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Ill starve ere Ill rob a foot further. An twere

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: not as good a deed as drink, to turn true man and to

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: leave these rogues, I am the veriest varlet that

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: ever chewed with a tooth. Eight yards of uneven

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: ground is threescore and ten miles afoot with me;

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: and the stony-hearted villains know it well enough:

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: a plague upon it when thieves cannot be true one to another!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: They whistle

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Whew! A plague upon you all! Give me my horse, you

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: rogues; give me my horse, and be hanged!

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Peace, ye fat-guts! lie down; lay thine ear close

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: to the ground and list if thou canst hear the tread

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: of travellers.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Have you any levers to lift me up again, being down?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Sblood, Ill not bear mine own flesh so far afoot

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: again for all the coin in thy fathers exchequer.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: What a plague mean ye to colt me thus?

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Thou liest; thou art not colted, thou art uncolted.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: I prithee, good Prince Hal, help me to my horse,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: good kings son.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Out, ye rogue! shall I be your ostler?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Go, hang thyself in thine own heir-apparent

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: garters! If I be taen, Ill peach for this. An I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: have not ballads made on you all and sung to filthy

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: tunes, let a cup of sack be my poison: when a jest

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: is so forward, and afoot too! I hate it.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Enter GADSHILL, BARDOLPH and PETO

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: Stand.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: So I do, against my will.

speaker: POINS
text_entry: O, tis our setter: I know his voice. Bardolph,

speaker: POINS
text_entry: what news?

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: Case ye, case ye; on with your vizards: there s

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: money of the kings coming down the hill; tis going

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: to the kings exchequer.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: You lie, ye rogue; tis going to the kings tavern.

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: Theres enough to make us all.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: To be hanged.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Sirs, you four shall front them in the narrow lane;

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Ned Poins and I will walk lower: if they scape

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: from your encounter, then they light on us.

speaker: PETO
text_entry: How many be there of them?

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: Some eight or ten.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Zounds, will they not rob us?

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: What, a coward, Sir John Paunch?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Indeed, I am not John of Gaunt, your grandfather;

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: but yet no coward, Hal.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Well, we leave that to the proof.

speaker: POINS
text_entry: Sirrah Jack, thy horse stands behind the hedge:

speaker: POINS
text_entry: when thou needest him, there thou shalt find him.

speaker: POINS
text_entry: Farewell, and stand fast.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Now cannot I strike him, if I should be hanged.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Ned, where are our disguises?

speaker: POINS
text_entry: Here, hard by: stand close.

speaker: POINS
text_entry: Exeunt PRINCE HENRY and POINS

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Now, my masters, happy man be his dole, say I:

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: every man to his business.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Enter the Travellers

speaker: First Traveller
text_entry: Come, neighbour: the boy shall lead our horses down

speaker: First Traveller
text_entry: the hill; well walk afoot awhile, and ease our legs.

speaker: Thieves
text_entry: Stand!

speaker: Travellers
text_entry: Jesus bless us!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Strike; down with them; cut the villains throats:

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: ah! whoreson caterpillars! bacon-fed knaves! they

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: hate us youth: down with them: fleece them.

speaker: Travellers
text_entry: O, we are undone, both we and ours for ever!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Hang ye, gorbellied knaves, are ye undone? No, ye

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: fat chuffs: I would your store were here! On,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: bacons, on! What, ye knaves! young men must live.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: You are Grand-jurors, are ye? well jure ye, faith.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Here they rob them and bind them. Exeunt

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Re-enter PRINCE HENRY and POINS

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: The thieves have bound the true men. Now could thou

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: and I rob the thieves and go merrily to London, it

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: would be argument for a week, laughter for a month

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: and a good jest for ever.

speaker: POINS
text_entry: Stand close; I hear them coming.

speaker: POINS
text_entry: Enter the Thieves again

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Come, my masters, let us share, and then to  horse

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: before day. An the Prince and Poins be not two

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: arrant cowards, theres no equity stirring: theres

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: no more valour in that Poins than in a wild-duck.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Your money!

speaker: POINS
text_entry: Villains!

speaker: POINS
text_entry: As they are sharing, the Prince and Poins set upon  them; they all run away; and Falstaff, after a blow or two, runs away too, leaving the booty behind them

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Got with much ease. Now merrily to horse:

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: The thieves are all scatterd and possessd with fear

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: So strongly that they dare not meet each other;

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Each takes his fellow for an officer.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Away, good Ned. Falstaff sweats to death,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: And lards the lean earth as he walks along:

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Were t not for laughing, I should pity him.

speaker: POINS
text_entry: How the rogue roard!

speaker: POINS
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: POINS
text_entry: SCENE III. Warkworth castle

speaker: POINS
text_entry: Enter HOTSPUR, solus, reading a letter

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: But for mine own part, my lord, I could be well

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: contented to be there, in respect of the love I bear

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: your house. He could be contented: why is he not,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: then? In respect of the love he bears our house:

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: he shows in this, he loves his own barn better than

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: he loves our house. Let me see some more. The

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: purpose you undertake is dangerous;--why, thats

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: certain: tis dangerous to take a cold, to sleep, to

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: drink; but I tell you, my lord fool, out of this

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: nettle, danger, we pluck this flower, safety. The

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: purpose you undertake is dangerous; the friends you

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: have named uncertain; the time itself unsorted; and

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: your whole plot too light for the counterpoise of so

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: great an opposition. Say you so, say you so? I say

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: unto you again, you are a shallow cowardly hind, and

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: you lie.  What a lack-brain is this! By the Lord,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: our plot is a good plot as ever was laid; our

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: friends true and constant: a good plot, good

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: friends, and full of expectation; an excellent plot,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: very good friends. What a frosty-spirited rogue is

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: this! Why, my lord of York commends the plot and the

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: general course of action. Zounds, an I were now by

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: this rascal, I could brain him with his ladys fan.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Is there not my father, my uncle and myself? lord

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Edmund Mortimer, My lord of York and Owen Glendower?

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: is there not besides the Douglas? have I not all

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: their letters to meet me in arms by the ninth of the

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: next month? and are they not some of them set

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: forward already? What a pagan rascal is this! an

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: infidel! Ha! you shall see now in very sincerity

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: of fear and cold heart, will he to the king and lay

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: open all our proceedings. O, I could divide myself

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: and go to buffets, for moving such a dish of

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: skim milk with so honourable an action! Hang him!

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: let him tell the king: we are prepared. I will set

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: forward to-night.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Enter LADY PERCY

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: How now, Kate! I must leave you within these two hours.

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: O, my good lord, why are you thus alone?

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: For what offence have I this fortnight been

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: A banishd woman from my Harrys bed?

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Tell me, sweet lord, what ist that takes from thee

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Thy stomach, pleasure and thy golden sleep?

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Why dost thou bend thine eyes upon the earth,

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: And start so often when thou sitst alone?

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Why hast thou lost the fresh blood in thy cheeks;

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: And given my treasures and my rights of thee

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: To thick-eyed musing and cursed melancholy?

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: In thy faint slumbers I by thee have watchd,

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: And heard thee murmur tales of iron wars;

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Speak terms of manage to thy bounding steed;

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Cry Courage! to the field! And thou hast talkd

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Of sallies and retires, of trenches, tents,

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Of palisadoes, frontiers, parapets,

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Of basilisks, of cannon, culverin,

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Of prisoners ransom and of soldiers slain,

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: And all the currents of a heady fight.

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Thy spirit within thee hath been so at war

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: And thus hath so bestirrd thee in thy sleep,

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: That beads of sweat have stood upon thy brow

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Like bubbles in a late-disturbed stream;

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: And in thy face strange motions have appeard,

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Such as we see when men restrain their breath

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: On some great sudden hest. O, what portents are these?

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Some heavy business hath my lord in hand,

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: And I must know it, else he loves me not.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: What, ho!

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Enter Servant

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Is Gilliams with the packet gone?

speaker: Servant
text_entry: He is, my lord, an hour ago.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Hath Butler brought those horses from the sheriff?

speaker: Servant
text_entry: One horse, my lord, he brought even now.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: What horse? a roan, a crop-ear, is it not?

speaker: Servant
text_entry: It is, my lord.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: That roan shall by my throne.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Well, I will back him straight: O esperance!

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Bid Butler lead him forth into the park.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Exit Servant

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: But hear you, my lord.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: What sayst thou, my lady?

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: What is it carries you away?

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Why, my horse, my love, my horse.

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Out, you mad-headed ape!

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: A weasel hath not such a deal of spleen

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: As you are tossd with. In faith,

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Ill know your business, Harry, that I will.

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: I fear my brother Mortimer doth stir

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: About his title, and hath sent for you

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: To line his enterprise: but if you go,--

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: So far afoot, I shall be weary, love.

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Come, come, you paraquito, answer me

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Directly unto this question that I ask:

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: In faith, Ill break thy little finger, Harry,

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: An if thou wilt not tell me all things true.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Away,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Away, you trifler! Love! I love thee not,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: I care not for thee, Kate: this is no world

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: To play with mammets and to tilt with lips:

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: We must have bloody noses and crackd crowns,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: And pass them current too. Gods me, my horse!

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: What sayst thou, Kate? what wouldst thou

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: have with me?

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Do you not love me? do you not, indeed?

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Well, do not then; for since you love me not,

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: I will not love myself. Do you not love me?

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Nay, tell me if you speak in jest or no.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Come, wilt thou see me ride?

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: And when I am on horseback, I will swear

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: I love thee infinitely. But hark you, Kate;

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: I must not have you henceforth question me

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Whither I go, nor reason whereabout:

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Whither I must, I must; and, to conclude,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: This evening must I leave you, gentle Kate.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: I know you wise, but yet no farther wise

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Than Harry Percys wife: constant you are,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: But yet a woman: and for secrecy,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: No lady closer; for I well believe

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Thou wilt not utter what thou dost not know;

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: And so far will I trust thee, gentle Kate.

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: How! so far?

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Not an inch further. But hark you, Kate:

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Whither I go, thither shall you go too;

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: To-day will I set forth, to-morrow you.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Will this content you, Kate?

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: It must of force.

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: SCENE IV. The Boars-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Enter PRINCE HENRY and POINS

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Ned, prithee, come out of that fat room, and lend me

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: thy hand to laugh a little.

speaker: POINS
text_entry: Where hast been, Hal?

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: With three or four loggerheads amongst three or four

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: score hogsheads. I have sounded the very

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: base-string of humility. Sirrah, I am sworn brother

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: to a leash of drawers; and can call them all by

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: their christen names, as Tom, Dick, and Francis.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: They take it already upon their salvation, that

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: though I be but the prince of Wales, yet I am king

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: of courtesy; and tell me flatly I am no proud Jack,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: like Falstaff, but a Corinthian, a lad of mettle, a

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: good boy, by the Lord, so they call me, and when I

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: am king of England, I shall command all the good

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: lads in Eastcheap. They call drinking deep, dyeing

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: scarlet; and when you breathe in your watering, they

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: cry  hem! and bid you play it off. To conclude, I

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: am so good a proficient in one quarter of an hour,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: that I can drink with any tinker in his own language

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: during my life. I tell thee, Ned, thou hast lost

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: much honour, that thou wert not with me in this sweet

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: action. But, sweet Ned,--to sweeten which name of

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Ned, I give thee this pennyworth of sugar, clapped

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: even now into my hand by an under-skinker, one that

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: never spake other English in his life than Eight

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: shillings and sixpence and You are welcome, with

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: this shrill addition, Anon, anon, sir! Score a pint

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: of bastard in the Half-Moon, or so. But, Ned, to

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: drive away the time till Falstaff come, I prithee,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: do thou stand in some by-room, while I question my

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: puny drawer to what end he gave me the sugar; and do

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: thou never leave calling Francis, that his tale

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: to me may be nothing but Anon. Step aside, and

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Ill show thee a precedent.

speaker: POINS
text_entry: Francis!

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Thou art perfect.

speaker: POINS
text_entry: Francis!

speaker: POINS
text_entry: Exit POINS

speaker: POINS
text_entry: Enter FRANCIS

speaker: FRANCIS
text_entry: Anon, anon, sir. Look down into the Pomgarnet, Ralph.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Come hither, Francis.

speaker: FRANCIS
text_entry: My lord?

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: How long hast thou to serve, Francis?

speaker: FRANCIS
text_entry: Forsooth, five years, and as much as to--

speaker: POINS
text_entry: [Within]  Francis!

speaker: FRANCIS
text_entry: Anon, anon, sir.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Five year! byr lady, a long lease for the clinking

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: of pewter. But, Francis, darest thou be so valiant

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: as to play the coward with thy indenture and show it

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: a fair pair of heels and run from it?

speaker: FRANCIS
text_entry: O Lord, sir, Ill be sworn upon all the books in

speaker: FRANCIS
text_entry: England, I could find in my heart.

speaker: POINS
text_entry: [Within]  Francis!

speaker: FRANCIS
text_entry: Anon, sir.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: How old art thou, Francis?

speaker: FRANCIS
text_entry: Let me see--about Michaelmas next I shall be--

speaker: POINS
text_entry: [Within]  Francis!

speaker: FRANCIS
text_entry: Anon, sir. Pray stay a little, my lord.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Nay, but hark you, Francis: for the sugar thou

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: gavest me,twas a pennyworth, wastt not?

speaker: FRANCIS
text_entry: O Lord, I would it had been two!

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: I will give thee for it a thousand pound: ask me

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: when thou wilt, and thou shalt have it.

speaker: POINS
text_entry: [Within]  Francis!

speaker: FRANCIS
text_entry: Anon, anon.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Anon, Francis? No, Francis; but to-morrow, Francis;

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: or, Francis, o Thursday; or indeed, Francis, when

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: thou wilt. But, Francis!

speaker: FRANCIS
text_entry: My lord?

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Wilt thou rob this leathern jerkin, crystal-button,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: not-pated, agate-ring, puke-stocking, caddis-garter,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: smooth-tongue, Spanish-pouch,--

speaker: FRANCIS
text_entry: O Lord, sir, who do you mean?

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Why, then, your brown bastard is your only drink;

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: for look you, Francis, your white canvas doublet

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: will sully: in Barbary, sir, it cannot come to so much.

speaker: FRANCIS
text_entry: What, sir?

speaker: POINS
text_entry: [Within]  Francis!

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Away, you rogue! dost thou not hear them call?

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Here they both call him; the drawer stands amazed, not knowing which way to go

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Enter Vintner

speaker: Vintner
text_entry: What, standest thou still, and hearest such a

speaker: Vintner
text_entry: calling? Look to the guests within.

speaker: Vintner
text_entry: Exit Francis

speaker: Vintner
text_entry: My lord, old Sir John, with half-a-dozen more, are

speaker: Vintner
text_entry: at the door: shall I let them in?

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Let them alone awhile, and then open the door.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Exit Vintner

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Poins!

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Re-enter POINS

speaker: POINS
text_entry: Anon, anon, sir.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Sirrah, Falstaff and the rest of the thieves are at

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: the door: shall we be merry?

speaker: POINS
text_entry: As merry as crickets, my lad. But hark ye; what

speaker: POINS
text_entry: cunning match have you made with this jest of the

speaker: POINS
text_entry: drawer? come, whats the issue?

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: I am now of all humours that have showed themselves

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: humours since the old days of goodman Adam to the

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: pupil age of this present twelve oclock at midnight.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Re-enter FRANCIS

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Whats oclock, Francis?

speaker: FRANCIS
text_entry: Anon, anon, sir.

speaker: FRANCIS
text_entry: Exit

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: That ever this fellow should have fewer words than a

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: parrot, and yet the son of a woman! His industry is

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: upstairs and downstairs; his eloquence the parcel of

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: a reckoning. I am not yet of Percys mind, the

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Hotspur of the north; he that kills me some six or

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: seven dozen of Scots at a breakfast, washes his

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: hands, and says to his wife Fie upon this quiet

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: life! I want work. O my sweet Harry, says she,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: how many hast thou killed to-day? Give my roan

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: horse a drench, says he; and answers Some

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: fourteen, an hour after; a trifle, a trifle. I

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: prithee, call in Falstaff: Ill play Percy, and

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: that damned brawn shall play Dame Mortimer his

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: wife. Rivo! says the drunkard. Call in ribs, call in tallow.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Enter FALSTAFF, GADSHILL, BARDOLPH, and PETO; FRANCIS following with wine

speaker: POINS
text_entry: Welcome, Jack: where hast thou been?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: A plague of all cowards, I say, and a vengeance too!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: marry, and amen! Give me a cup of sack, boy. Ere I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: lead this life long, Ill sew nether stocks and mend

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: them and foot them too. A plague of all cowards!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Give me a cup of sack, rogue. Is there no virtue extant?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: He drinks

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Didst thou never see Titan kiss a dish of butter?

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: pitiful-hearted Titan, that melted at the sweet tale

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: of the suns! if thou didst, then behold that compound.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: You rogue, heres lime in this sack too: there is

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: nothing but roguery to be found in villanous man:

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: yet a coward is worse than a cup of sack with lime

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: in it. A villanous coward! Go thy ways, old Jack;

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: die when thou wilt, if manhood, good manhood, be

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: not forgot upon the face of the earth, then am I a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: shotten herring. There live not three good men

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: unhanged in England; and one of them is fat and

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: grows old: God help the while! a bad world, I say.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: I would I were a weaver; I could sing psalms or any

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: thing. A plague of all cowards, I say still.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: How now, wool-sack! what mutter you?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: A kings son! If I do not beat thee out of thy

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: kingdom with a dagger of lath, and drive all thy

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: subjects afore thee like a flock of wild-geese,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Ill never wear hair on my face more. You Prince of Wales!

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Why, you whoreson round man, whats the matter?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Are not you a coward? answer me to that: and Poins there?

speaker: POINS
text_entry: Zounds, ye fat paunch, an ye call me coward, by the

speaker: POINS
text_entry: Lord, Ill stab thee.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: I call thee coward! Ill see thee damned ere I call

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: thee coward: but I would give a thousand pound I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: could run as fast as thou canst. You are straight

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: enough in the shoulders, you care not who sees your

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: back: call you that backing of your friends? A

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: plague upon such backing! give me them that will

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: face me. Give me a cup of sack: I am a rogue, if I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: drunk to-day.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: O villain! thy lips are scarce wiped since thou

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: drunkest last.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Alls one for that.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: He drinks

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: A plague of all cowards, still say I.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Whats the matter?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Whats the matter! there be four of us here have

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: taen a thousand pound this day morning.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Where is it, Jack? where is it?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Where is it! taken from us it is: a hundred upon

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: poor four of us.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: What, a hundred, man?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: I am a rogue, if I were not at half-sword with a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: dozen of them two hours together. I have scaped by

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: miracle. I am eight times thrust through the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: doublet, four through the hose; my buckler cut

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: through and through; my sword hacked like a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: hand-saw--ecce signum! I never dealt better since

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: I was a man: all would not do. A plague of all

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: cowards! Let them speak: if they speak more or

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: less than truth, they are villains and the sons of darkness.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Speak, sirs; how was it?

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: We four set upon some dozen--

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Sixteen at least, my lord.

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: And bound them.

speaker: PETO
text_entry: No, no, they were not bound.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: You rogue, they were bound, every man of them; or I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: am a Jew else, an Ebrew Jew.

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: As we were sharing, some six or seven fresh men set upon us--

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: And unbound the rest, and then come in the other.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: What, fought you with them all?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: All! I know not what you call all; but if I fought

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: not with fifty of them, I am a bunch of radish: if

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: there were not two or three and fifty upon poor old

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Jack, then am I no two-legged creature.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Pray God you have not murdered some of them.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Nay, thats past praying for: I have peppered two

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: of them; two I am sure I have paid, two rogues

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: in buckram suits. I tell thee what, Hal, if I tell

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: thee a lie, spit in my face, call me horse. Thou

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: knowest my old ward; here I lay and thus I bore my

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: point. Four rogues in buckram let drive at me--

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: What, four? thou saidst but two even now.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Four, Hal; I told thee four.

speaker: POINS
text_entry: Ay, ay, he said four.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: These four came all a-front, and mainly thrust at

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: me. I made me no more ado but took all their seven

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: points in my target, thus.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Seven? why, there were but four even now.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: In buckram?

speaker: POINS
text_entry: Ay, four, in buckram suits.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Seven, by these hilts, or I am a villain else.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Prithee, let him alone; we shall have more anon.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Dost thou hear me, Hal?

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Ay, and mark thee too, Jack.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Do so, for it is worth the listening to. These nine

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: in buckram that I told thee of--

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: So, two more already.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Their points being broken,--

speaker: POINS
text_entry: Down fell their hose.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Began to give me ground: but I followed me close,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: came in foot and hand; and with a thought seven of

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: the eleven I paid.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: O monstrous! eleven buckram men grown out of two!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: But, as the devil would have it, three misbegotten

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: knaves in Kendal green came at my back and let drive

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: at me; for it was so dark, Hal, that thou couldst

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: not see thy hand.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: These lies are like their father that begets them;

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: gross as a mountain, open, palpable. Why, thou

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: clay-brained guts, thou knotty-pated fool, thou

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: whoreson, obscene, grease tallow-catch,--

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: What, art thou mad? art thou mad? is not the truth

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: the truth?

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Why, how couldst thou know these men in Kendal

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: green, when it was so dark thou couldst not see thy

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: hand? come, tell us your reason: what sayest thou to this?

speaker: POINS
text_entry: Come, your reason, Jack, your reason.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: What, upon compulsion? Zounds, an I were at the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: strappado, or all the racks in the world, I would

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: not tell you on compulsion. Give you a reason on

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: compulsion! If reasons were as plentiful as

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: blackberries, I would give no man a reason upon

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: compulsion, I.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Ill be no longer guilty of this sin; this sanguine

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: coward, this bed-presser, this horseback-breaker,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: this huge hill of flesh,--

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Sblood, you starveling, you elf-skin, you dried

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: neats tongue, you bulls pizzle, you stock-fish! O

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: for breath to utter what is like thee! you

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: tailors-yard, you sheath, you bowcase; you vile

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: standing-tuck,--

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Well, breathe awhile, and then to it again: and

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: when thou hast tired thyself in base comparisons,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: hear me speak but this.

speaker: POINS
text_entry: Mark, Jack.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: We two saw you four set on four and bound them, and

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: were masters of their wealth. Mark now, how a plain

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: tale shall put you down. Then did we two set on you

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: four; and, with a word, out-faced you from your

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: prize, and have it; yea, and can show it you here in

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: the house: and, Falstaff, you carried your guts

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: away as nimbly, with as quick dexterity, and roared

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: for mercy and still run and roared, as ever I heard

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: bull-calf. What a slave art thou, to hack thy sword

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: as thou hast done, and then say it was in fight!

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: What trick, what device, what starting-hole, canst

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: thou now find out to hide thee from this open and

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: apparent shame?

speaker: POINS
text_entry: Come, lets hear, Jack; what trick hast thou now?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: By the Lord, I knew ye as well as he that made ye.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Why, hear you, my masters: was it for me to kill the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: heir-apparent? should I turn upon the true prince?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: why, thou knowest I am as valiant as Hercules: but

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: beware instinct; the lion will not touch the true

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: prince. Instinct is a great matter; I was now a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: coward on instinct. I shall think the better of

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: myself and thee during my life; I for a valiant

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: lion, and thou for a true prince. But, by the Lord,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: lads, I am glad you have the money. Hostess, clap

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: to the doors: watch to-night, pray to-morrow.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Gallants, lads, boys, hearts of gold, all the titles

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: of good fellowship come to you! What, shall we be

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: merry? shall we have a play extempore?

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Content; and the argument shall be thy running away.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Ah, no more of that, Hal, an thou lovest me!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Enter Hostess

speaker: Hostess
text_entry: O Jesu, my lord the prince!

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: How now, my lady the hostess! what sayest thou to

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: me?

speaker: Hostess
text_entry: Marry, my lord, there is a nobleman of the court at

speaker: Hostess
text_entry: door would speak with you: he says he comes from

speaker: Hostess
text_entry: your father.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Give him as much as will make him a royal man, and

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: send him back again to my mother.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: What manner of man is he?

speaker: Hostess
text_entry: An old man.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: What doth gravity out of his bed at midnight? Shall

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: I give him his answer?

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Prithee, do, Jack.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Faith, and Ill send him packing.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Exit FALSTAFF

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Now, sirs: byr lady, you fought fair; so did you,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Peto; so did you, Bardolph: you are lions too, you

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: ran away upon instinct, you will not touch the true

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: prince; no, fie!

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: Faith, I ran when I saw others run.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Faith, tell me now in earnest, how came Falstaffs

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: sword so hacked?

speaker: PETO
text_entry: Why, he hacked it with his dagger, and said he would

speaker: PETO
text_entry: swear truth out of England but he would make you

speaker: PETO
text_entry: believe it was done in fight, and persuaded us to do the like.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: Yea, and to tickle our noses with spear-grass to

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: make them bleed, and then to beslubber our garments

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: with it and swear it was the blood of true men. I

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: did that I did not this seven year before, I blushed

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: to hear his monstrous devices.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: O villain, thou stolest a cup of sack eighteen years

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: ago, and wert taken with the manner, and ever since

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: thou hast blushed extempore. Thou hadst fire and

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: sword on thy side, and yet thou rannest away: what

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: instinct hadst thou for it?

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: My lord, do you see these meteors? do you behold

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: these exhalations?

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: I do.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: What think you they portend?

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Hot livers and cold purses.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: Choler, my lord, if rightly taken.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: No, if rightly taken, halter.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Re-enter FALSTAFF

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Here comes lean Jack, here comes bare-bone.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: How now, my sweet creature of bombast!

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: How long ist ago, Jack, since thou sawest thine own knee?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: My own knee! when I was about thy years, Hal, I was

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: not an eagles talon in the waist; I could have

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: crept into any aldermans thumb-ring: a plague of

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: sighing and grief! it blows a man up like a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: bladder. Theres villanous news abroad: here was

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Sir John Bracy from your father; you must to the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: court in the morning. That same mad fellow of the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: north, Percy, and he of Wales, that gave Amamon the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: bastinado and made Lucifer cuckold and swore the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: devil his true liegeman upon the cross of a Welsh

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: hook--what a plague call you him?

speaker: POINS
text_entry: O, Glendower.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Owen, Owen, the same; and his son-in-law Mortimer,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: and old Northumberland, and that sprightly Scot of

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Scots, Douglas, that runs o horseback up a hill

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: perpendicular,--

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: He that rides at high speed and with his pistol

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: kills a sparrow flying.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: You have hit it.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: So did he never the sparrow.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Well, that rascal hath good mettle in him; he will not run.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Why, what a rascal art thou then, to praise him so

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: for running!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: O horseback, ye cuckoo; but afoot he will not budge a foot.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Yes, Jack, upon instinct.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: I grant ye, upon instinct. Well, he is there too,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: and one Mordake, and a thousand blue-caps more:

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Worcester is stolen away to-night; thy fathers

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: beard is turned white with the news: you may buy

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: land now as cheap as stinking mackerel.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Why, then, it is like, if there come a hot June and

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: this civil buffeting hold, we shall buy maidenheads

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: as they buy hob-nails, by the hundreds.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: By the mass, lad, thou sayest true; it is like we

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: shall have good trading that way. But tell me, Hal,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: art not thou horrible afeard? thou being

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: heir-apparent, could the world pick thee out three

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: such enemies again as that fiend Douglas, that

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: spirit Percy, and that devil Glendower? Art thou

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: not horribly afraid? doth not thy blood thrill at

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: it?

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Not a whit, i faith; I lack some of thy instinct.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Well, thou wert be horribly chid tomorrow when thou

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: comest to thy father: if thou love me, practise an answer.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Do thou stand for my father, and examine me upon the

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: particulars of my life.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Shall I? content: this chair shall be my state,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: this dagger my sceptre, and this cushion my crown.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Thy state is taken for a joined-stool, thy golden

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: sceptre for a leaden dagger, and thy precious rich

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: crown for a pitiful bald crown!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Well, an the fire of grace be not quite out of thee,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: now shalt thou be moved. Give me a cup of sack to

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: make my eyes look red, that it may be thought I have

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: wept; for I must speak in passion, and I will do it

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: in King Cambyses vein.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Well, here is my leg.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: And here is my speech. Stand aside, nobility.

speaker: Hostess
text_entry: O Jesu, this is excellent sport, i faith!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Weep not, sweet queen; for trickling tears are vain.

speaker: Hostess
text_entry: O, the father, how he holds his countenance!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: For Gods sake, lords, convey my tristful queen;

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: For tears do stop the flood-gates of her eyes.

speaker: Hostess
text_entry: O Jesu, he doth it as like one of these harlotry

speaker: Hostess
text_entry: players as ever I see!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Peace, good pint-pot; peace, good tickle-brain.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Harry, I do not only marvel where thou spendest thy

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: time, but also how thou art accompanied: for though

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: the camomile, the more it is trodden on the faster

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: it grows, yet youth, the more it is wasted the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: sooner it wears. That thou art my son, I have

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: partly thy mothers word, partly my own opinion,

speaker: FALSTAFF
