text_entry: but chiefly a villanous trick of thine eye and a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: foolish-hanging of thy nether lip, that doth warrant

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: me. If then thou be son to me, here lies the point;

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: why, being son to me, art thou so pointed at? Shall

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: the blessed sun of heaven prove a micher and eat

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: blackberries? a question not to be asked. Shall

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: the sun of England prove a thief and take purses? a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: question to be asked. There is a thing, Harry,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: which thou hast often heard of and it is known to

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: many in our land by the name of pitch: this pitch,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: as ancient writers do report, doth defile; so doth

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: the company thou keepest: for, Harry, now I do not

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: speak to thee in drink but in tears, not in

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: pleasure but in passion, not in words only, but in

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: woes also: and yet there is a virtuous man whom I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: have often noted in thy company, but I know not his name.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: What manner of man, an it like your majesty?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: A goodly portly man, i faith, and a corpulent; of a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: cheerful look, a pleasing eye and a most noble

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: carriage; and, as I think, his age some fifty, or,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: byr lady, inclining to three score; and now I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: remember me, his name is Falstaff: if that man

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: should be lewdly given, he deceiveth me; for, Harry,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: I see virtue in his looks. If then the tree may be

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: known by the fruit, as the fruit by the tree, then,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: peremptorily I speak it, there is virtue in that

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Falstaff: him keep with, the rest banish. And tell

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: me now, thou naughty varlet, tell me, where hast

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: thou been this month?

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Dost thou speak like a king? Do thou stand for me,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: and Ill play my father.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Depose me? if thou dost it half so gravely, so

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: majestically, both in word and matter, hang me up by

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: the heels for a rabbit-sucker or a poulters hare.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Well, here I am set.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: And here I stand: judge, my masters.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Now, Harry, whence come you?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: My noble lord, from Eastcheap.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: The complaints I hear of thee are grievous.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Sblood, my lord, they are false: nay, Ill tickle

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: ye for a young prince, i faith.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Swearest thou, ungracious boy? henceforth neer look

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: on me. Thou art violently carried away from grace:

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: there is a devil haunts thee in the likeness of an

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: old fat man; a tun of man is thy companion. Why

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: dost thou converse with that trunk of humours, that

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: bolting-hutch of beastliness, that swollen parcel

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: of dropsies, that huge bombard of sack, that stuffed

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: cloak-bag of guts, that roasted Manningtree ox with

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: the pudding in his belly, that reverend vice, that

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: grey iniquity, that father ruffian, that vanity in

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: years? Wherein is he good, but to taste sack and

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: drink it? wherein neat and cleanly, but to carve a

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: capon and eat it? wherein cunning, but in craft?

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: wherein crafty, but in villany? wherein villanous,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: but in all things? wherein worthy, but in nothing?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: I would your grace would take me with you: whom

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: means your grace?

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: That villanous abominable misleader of youth,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Falstaff, that old white-bearded Satan.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: My lord, the man I know.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: I know thou dost.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: But to say I know more harm in him than in myself,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: were to say more than I know. That he is old, the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: more the pity, his white hairs do witness it; but

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: that he is, saving your reverence, a whoremaster,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: that I utterly deny. If sack and sugar be a fault,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: God help the wicked! if to be old and merry be a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: sin, then many an old host that I know is damned: if

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: to be fat be to be hated, then Pharaohs lean kine

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: are to be loved. No, my good lord; banish Peto,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: banish Bardolph, banish Poins: but for sweet Jack

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Falstaff, kind Jack Falstaff, true Jack Falstaff,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: valiant Jack Falstaff, and therefore more valiant,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: being, as he is, old Jack Falstaff, banish not him

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: thy Harrys company, banish not him thy Harrys

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: company: banish plump Jack, and banish all the world.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: I do, I will.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: A knocking heard

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Exeunt Hostess, FRANCIS, and BARDOLPH

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Re-enter BARDOLPH, running

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: O, my lord, my lord! the sheriff with a most

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: monstrous watch is at the door.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Out, ye rogue! Play out the play: I have much to

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: say in the behalf of that Falstaff.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Re-enter the Hostess

speaker: Hostess
text_entry: O Jesu, my lord, my lord!

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Heigh, heigh! the devil rides upon a fiddlestick:

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: whats the matter?

speaker: Hostess
text_entry: The sheriff and all the watch are at the door: they

speaker: Hostess
text_entry: are come to search the house. Shall I let them in?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Dost thou hear, Hal? never call a true piece of

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: gold a counterfeit: thou art essentially mad,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: without seeming so.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: And thou a natural coward, without instinct.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: I deny your major: if you will deny the sheriff,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: so; if not, let him enter: if I become not a cart

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: as well as another man, a plague on my bringing up!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: I hope I shall as soon be strangled with a halter as another.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Go, hide thee behind the arras: the rest walk up

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: above. Now, my masters, for a true face and good

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: conscience.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Both which I have had: but their date is out, and

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: therefore Ill hide me.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Call in the sheriff.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Exeunt all except PRINCE HENRY and PETO

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Enter Sheriff and the Carrier

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Now, master sheriff, what is your will with me?

speaker: Sheriff
text_entry: First, pardon me, my lord. A hue and cry

speaker: Sheriff
text_entry: Hath followd certain men unto this house.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: What men?

speaker: Sheriff
text_entry: One of them is well known, my gracious lord,

speaker: Sheriff
text_entry: A gross fat man.

speaker: Carrier
text_entry: As fat as butter.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: The man, I do assure you, is not here;

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: For I myself at this time have employd him.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: And, sheriff, I will engage my word to thee

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: That I will, by to-morrow dinner-time,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Send him to answer thee, or any man,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: For any thing he shall be charged withal:

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: And so let me entreat you leave the house.

speaker: Sheriff
text_entry: I will, my lord. There are two gentlemen

speaker: Sheriff
text_entry: Have in this robbery lost three hundred marks.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: It may be so: if he have robbd these men,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: He shall be answerable; and so farewell.

speaker: Sheriff
text_entry: Good night, my noble lord.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: I think it is good morrow, is it not?

speaker: Sheriff
text_entry: Indeed, my lord, I think it be two oclock.

speaker: Sheriff
text_entry: Exeunt Sheriff and Carrier

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: This oily rascal is known as well as Pauls. Go,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: call him forth.

speaker: PETO
text_entry: Falstaff!--Fast asleep behind the arras, and

speaker: PETO
text_entry: snorting like a horse.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Hark, how hard he fetches breath. Search his pockets.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: He searcheth his pockets, and findeth certain papers

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: What hast thou found?

speaker: PETO
text_entry: Nothing but papers, my lord.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Lets see what they be: read them.

speaker: PETO
text_entry: [Reads]  Item, A capon,. . 2s. 2d.

speaker: PETO
text_entry: Item, Sauce,. . . 4d.

speaker: PETO
text_entry: Item, Sack, two gallons, 5s. 8d.

speaker: PETO
text_entry: Item, Anchovies and sack after supper, 2s. 6d.

speaker: PETO
text_entry: Item, Bread,        ob.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: O monstrous! but one half-penny-worth of bread to

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: this intolerable deal of sack! What there is else,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: keep close; well read it at more advantage: there

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: let him sleep till day. Ill to the court in the

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: morning. We must all to the wars, and thy place

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: shall be honourable. Ill procure this fat rogue a

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: charge of foot; and I know his death will be a

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: march of twelve-score. The money shall be paid

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: back again with advantage. Be with me betimes in

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: the morning; and so, good morrow, Peto.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: PETO
text_entry: Good morrow, good my lord.

speaker: PETO
text_entry: ACT III

speaker: PETO
text_entry: SCENE I. Bangor. The Archdeacons house.

speaker: PETO
text_entry: Enter HOTSPUR, WORCESTER, MORTIMER, and GLENDOWER

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: These promises are fair, the parties sure,

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: And our induction full of prosperous hope.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Lord Mortimer, and cousin Glendower,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Will you sit down?

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: And uncle Worcester: a plague upon it!

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: I have forgot the map.

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: No, here it is.

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: Sit, cousin Percy; sit, good cousin Hotspur,

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: For by that name as oft as Lancaster

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: Doth speak of you, his cheek looks pale and with

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: A rising sigh he wisheth you in heaven.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: And you in hell, as oft as he hears Owen Glendower spoke of.

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: I cannot blame him: at my nativity

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: The front of heaven was full of fiery shapes,

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: Of burning cressets; and at my birth

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: The frame and huge foundation of the earth

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: Shaked like a coward.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Why, so it would have done at the same season, if

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: your mothers cat had but kittened, though yourself

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: had never been born.

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: I say the earth did shake when I was born.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: And I say the earth was not of my mind,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: If you suppose as fearing you it shook.

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: The heavens were all on fire, the earth did tremble.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: O, then the earth shook to see the heavens on fire,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: And not in fear of your nativity.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Diseased nature oftentimes breaks forth

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: In strange eruptions; oft the teeming earth

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Is with a kind of colic pinchd and vexd

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: By the imprisoning of unruly wind

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Within her womb; which, for enlargement striving,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Shakes the old beldam earth and topples down

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Steeples and moss-grown towers. At your birth

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Our grandam earth, having this distemperature,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: In passion shook.

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: Cousin, of many men

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: I do not bear these crossings. Give me leave

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: To tell you once again that at my birth

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: The front of heaven was full of fiery shapes,

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: The goats ran from the mountains, and the herds

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: Were strangely clamorous to the frighted fields.

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: These signs have markd me extraordinary;

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: And all the courses of my life do show

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: I am not in the roll of common men.

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: Where is he living, clippd in with the sea

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: That chides the banks of England, Scotland, Wales,

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: Which calls me pupil, or hath read to me?

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: And bring him out that is but womans son

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: Can trace me in the tedious ways of art

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: And hold me pace in deep experiments.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: I think theres no man speaks better Welsh.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Ill to dinner.

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: Peace, cousin Percy; you will make him mad.

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: I can call spirits from the vasty deep.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Why, so can I, or so can any man;

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: But will they come when you do call for them?

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: Why, I can teach you, cousin, to command

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: The devil.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: And I can teach thee, coz, to shame the devil

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: By telling truth: tell truth and shame the devil.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: If thou have power to raise him, bring him hither,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: And Ill be sworn I have power to shame him hence.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: O, while you live, tell truth and shame the devil!

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: Come, come, no more of this unprofitable chat.

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: Three times hath Henry Bolingbroke made head

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: Against my power; thrice from the banks of Wye

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: And sandy-bottomd Severn have I sent him

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: Bootless home and weather-beaten back.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Home without boots, and in foul weather too!

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: How scapes he agues, in the devils name?

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: Come, heres the map: shall we divide our right

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: According to our threefold order taen?

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: The archdeacon hath divided it

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: Into three limits very equally:

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: England, from Trent and Severn hitherto,

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: By south and east is to my part assignd:

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: All westward, Wales beyond the Severn shore,

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: And all the fertile land within that bound,

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: To Owen Glendower: and, dear coz, to you

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: The remnant northward, lying off from Trent.

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: And our indentures tripartite are drawn;

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: Which being sealed interchangeably,

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: A business that this night may execute,

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: To-morrow, cousin Percy, you and I

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: And my good Lord of Worcester will set forth

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: To meet your father and the Scottish power,

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: As is appointed us, at Shrewsbury.

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: My father Glendower is not ready yet,

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: Not shall we need his help these fourteen days.

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: Within that space you may have drawn together

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: Your tenants, friends and neighbouring gentlemen.

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: A shorter time shall send me to you, lords:

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: And in my conduct shall your ladies come;

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: From whom you now must steal and take no leave,

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: For there will be a world of water shed

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: Upon the parting of your wives and you.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Methinks my moiety, north from Burton here,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: In quantity equals not one of yours:

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: See how this river comes me cranking in,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: And cuts me from the best of all my land

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: A huge half-moon, a monstrous cantle out.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Ill have the current in this place dammd up;

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: And here the smug and silver Trent shall run

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: In a new channel, fair and evenly;

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: It shall not wind with such a deep indent,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: To rob me of so rich a bottom here.

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: Not wind? it shall, it must; you see it doth.

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: Yea, but

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: Mark how he bears his course, and runs me up

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: With like advantage on the other side;

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: Gelding the opposed continent as much

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: As on the other side it takes from you.

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: Yea, but a little charge will trench him here

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: And on this north side win this cape of land;

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: And then he runs straight and even.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Ill have it so: a little charge will do it.

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: Ill not have it alterd.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Will not you?

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: No, nor you shall not.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Who shall say me nay?

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: Why, that will I.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Let me not understand you, then; speak it in Welsh.

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: I can speak English, lord, as well as you;

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: For I was traind up in the English court;

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: Where, being but young, I framed to the harp

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: Many an English ditty lovely well

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: And gave the tongue a helpful ornament,

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: A virtue that was never seen in you.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Marry,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: And I am glad of it with all my heart:

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: I had rather be a kitten and cry mew

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Than one of these same metre ballad-mongers;

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: I had rather hear a brazen canstick turnd,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Or a dry wheel grate on the axle-tree;

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: And that would set my teeth nothing on edge,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Nothing so much as mincing poetry:

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Tis like the forced gait of a shuffling nag.

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: Come, you shall have Trent turnd.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: I do not care: Ill give thrice so much land

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: To any well-deserving friend;

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: But in the way of bargain, mark ye me,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Ill cavil on the ninth part of a hair.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Are the indentures drawn? shall we be gone?

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: The moon shines fair; you may away by night:

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: Ill haste the writer and withal

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: Break with your wives of your departure hence:

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: I am afraid my daughter will run mad,

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: So much she doteth on her Mortimer.

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: Exit GLENDOWER

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: Fie, cousin Percy! how you cross my father!

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: I cannot choose: sometime he angers me

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: With telling me of the mouldwarp and the ant,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Of the dreamer Merlin and his prophecies,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: And of a dragon and a finless fish,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: A clip-wingd griffin and a moulten raven,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: A couching lion and a ramping cat,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: And such a deal of skimble-skamble stuff

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: As puts me from my faith. I tell you what;

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: He held me last night at least nine hours

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: In reckoning up the several devils names

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: That were his lackeys: I cried hum, and well, go to,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: But markd him not a word. O, he is as tedious

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: As a tired horse, a railing wife;

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Worse than a smoky house: I had rather live

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: With cheese and garlic in a windmill, far,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Than feed on cates and have him talk to me

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: In any summer-house in Christendom.

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: In faith, he is a worthy gentleman,

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: Exceedingly well read, and profited

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: In strange concealments, valiant as a lion

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: And as wondrous affable and as bountiful

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: As mines of India. Shall I tell you, cousin?

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: He holds your temper in a high respect

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: And curbs himself even of his natural scope

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: When you come cross his humour; faith, he does:

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: I warrant you, that man is not alive

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: Might so have tempted him as you have done,

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: Without the taste of danger and reproof:

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: But do not use it oft, let me entreat you.

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: In faith, my lord, you are too wilful-blame;

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: And since your coming hither have done enough

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: To put him quite beside his patience.

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: You must needs learn, lord, to amend this fault:

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: Though sometimes it show greatness, courage, blood,--

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: And thats the dearest grace it renders you,--

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: Yet oftentimes it doth present harsh rage,

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: Defect of manners, want of government,

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: Pride, haughtiness, opinion and disdain:

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: The least of which haunting a nobleman

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: Loseth mens hearts and leaves behind a stain

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: Upon the beauty of all parts besides,

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: Beguiling them of commendation.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Well, I am schoold: good manners be your speed!

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Here come our wives, and let us take our leave.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Re-enter GLENDOWER with the ladies

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: This is the deadly spite that angers me;

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: My wife can speak no English, I no Welsh.

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: My daughter weeps: she will not part with you;

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: Shell be a soldier too, shell to the wars.

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: Good father, tell her that she and my aunt Percy

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: Shall follow in your conduct speedily.

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: Glendower speaks to her in Welsh, and she answers him in the same

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: She is desperate here; a peevish self-wind harlotry,

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: one that no persuasion can do good upon.

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: The lady speaks in Welsh

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: I understand thy looks: that pretty Welsh

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: Which thou pourst down from these swelling heavens

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: I am too perfect in; and, but for shame,

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: In such a parley should I answer thee.

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: The lady speaks again in Welsh

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: I understand thy kisses and thou mine,

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: And thats a feeling disputation:

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: But I will never be a truant, love,

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: Till I have learned thy language; for thy tongue

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: Makes Welsh as sweet as ditties highly pennd,

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: Sung by a fair queen in a summers bower,

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: With ravishing division, to her lute.

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: Nay, if you melt, then will she run mad.

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: The lady speaks again in Welsh

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: O, I am ignorance itself in this!

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: She bids you on the wanton rushes lay you down

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: And rest your gentle head upon her lap,

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: And she will sing the song that pleaseth you

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: And on your eyelids crown the god of sleep.

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: Charming your blood with pleasing heaviness,

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: Making such difference twixt wake and sleep

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: As is the difference betwixt day and night

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: The hour before the heavenly-harnessd team

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: Begins his golden progress in the east.

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: With all my heart Ill sit and hear her sing:

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: By that time will our book, I think, be drawn

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: Do so;

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: And those musicians that shall play to you

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: Hang in the air a thousand leagues from hence,

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: And straight they shall be here: sit, and attend.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Come, Kate, thou art perfect in lying down: come,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: quick, quick, that I may lay my head in thy lap.

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Go, ye giddy goose.

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: The music plays

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Now I perceive the devil understands Welsh;

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: And tis no marvel he is so humorous.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Byr lady, he is a good musician.

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Then should you be nothing but musical for you are

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: altogether governed by humours. Lie still, ye thief,

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: and hear the lady sing in Welsh.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: I had rather hear Lady, my brach, howl in Irish.

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Wouldst thou have thy head broken?

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: No.

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Then be still.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Neither;tis a womans fault.

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Now God help thee!

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: To the Welsh ladys bed.

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Whats that?

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Peace! she sings.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Here the lady sings a Welsh song

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Come, Kate, Ill have your song too.

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Not mine, in good sooth.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Not yours, in good sooth! Heart! you swear like a

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: comfit-makers wife. Not you, in good sooth, and

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: as true as I live, and as God shall mend me, and

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: as sure as day,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: And givest such sarcenet surety for thy oaths,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: As if thou never walkst further than Finsbury.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Swear me, Kate, like a lady as thou art,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: A good mouth-filling oath, and leave in sooth,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: And such protest of pepper-gingerbread,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: To velvet-guards and Sunday-citizens.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Come, sing.

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: I will not sing.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Tis the next way to turn tailor, or be red-breast

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: teacher. An the indentures be drawn, Ill away

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: within these two hours; and so, come in when ye will.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Exit

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: Come, come, Lord Mortimer; you are as slow

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: As hot Lord Percy is on fire to go.

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: By this our book is drawn; well but seal,

speaker: GLENDOWER
text_entry: And then to horse immediately.

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: With all my heart.

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: SCENE II. London. The palace.

speaker: MORTIMER
text_entry: Enter KING HENRY IV, PRINCE HENRY, and others

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Lords, give us leave; the Prince of Wales and I

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Must have some private conference; but be near at hand,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: For we shall presently have need of you.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Exeunt Lords

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: I know not whether God will have it so,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: For some displeasing service I have done,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: That, in his secret doom, out of my blood

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Hell breed revengement and a scourge for me;

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: But thou dost in thy passages of life

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Make me believe that thou art only markd

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: For the hot vengeance and the rod of heaven

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: To punish my mistreadings. Tell me else,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Could such inordinate and low desires,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Such poor, such bare, such lewd, such mean attempts,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Such barren pleasures, rude society,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: As thou art matchd withal and grafted to,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Accompany the greatness of thy blood

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: And hold their level with thy princely heart?

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: So please your majesty, I would I could

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Quit all offences with as clear excuse

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: As well as I am doubtless I can purge

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Myself of many I am charged withal:

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Yet such extenuation let me beg,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: As, in reproof of many tales devised,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: which oft the ear of greatness needs must hear,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: By smiling pick-thanks and base news-mongers,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: I may, for some things true, wherein my youth

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Hath faulty wanderd and irregular,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Find pardon on my true submission.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: God pardon thee! yet let me wonder, Harry,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: At thy affections, which do hold a wing

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Quite from the flight of all thy ancestors.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Thy place in council thou hast rudely lost.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Which by thy younger brother is supplied,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: And art almost an alien to the hearts

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Of all the court and princes of my blood:

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: The hope and expectation of thy time

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Is ruind, and the soul of every man

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Prophetically doth forethink thy fall.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Had I so lavish of my presence been,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: So common-hackneyd in the eyes of men,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: So stale and cheap to vulgar company,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Opinion, that did help me to the crown,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Had still kept loyal to possession

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: And left me in reputeless banishment,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: A fellow of no mark nor likelihood.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: By being seldom seen, I could not stir

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: But like a comet I was wonderd at;

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: That men would tell their children This is he;

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Others would say Where, which is Bolingbroke?

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: And then I stole all courtesy from heaven,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: And dressd myself in such humility

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: That I did pluck allegiance from mens hearts,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Loud shouts and salutations from their mouths,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Even in the presence of the crowned king.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Thus did I keep my person fresh and new;

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: My presence, like a robe pontifical,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Neer seen but wonderd at: and so my state,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Seldom but sumptuous, showed like a feast

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: And won by rareness such solemnity.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: The skipping king, he ambled up and down

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: With shallow jesters and rash bavin wits,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Soon kindled and soon burnt; carded his state,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Mingled his royalty with capering fools,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Had his great name profaned with their scorns

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: And gave his countenance, against his name,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: To laugh at gibing boys and stand the push

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Of every beardless vain comparative,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Grew a companion to the common streets,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Enfeoffd himself to popularity;

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: That, being daily swallowd by mens eyes,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: They surfeited with honey and began

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: To loathe the taste of sweetness, whereof a little

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: More than a little is by much too much.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: So when he had occasion to be seen,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: He was but as the cuckoo is in June,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Heard, not regarded; seen, but with such eyes

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: As, sick and blunted with community,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Afford no extraordinary gaze,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Such as is bent on sun-like majesty

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: When it shines seldom in admiring eyes;

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: But rather drowzed and hung their eyelids down,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Slept in his face and renderd such aspect

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: As cloudy men use to their adversaries,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Being with his presence glutted, gorged and full.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: And in that very line, Harry, standest thou;

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: For thou has lost thy princely privilege

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: With vile participation: not an eye

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: But is a-weary of thy common sight,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Save mine, which hath desired to see thee more;

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Which now doth that I would not have it do,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Make blind itself with foolish tenderness.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: I shall hereafter, my thrice gracious lord,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Be more myself.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: For all the world

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: As thou art to this hour was Richard then

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: When I from France set foot at Ravenspurgh,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: And even as I was then is Percy now.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Now, by my sceptre and my soul to boot,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: He hath more worthy interest to the state

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Than thou the shadow of succession;

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: For of no right, nor colour like to right,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: He doth fill fields with harness in the realm,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Turns head against the lions armed jaws,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: And, being no more in debt to years than thou,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Leads ancient lords and reverend bishops on

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: To bloody battles and to bruising arms.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: What never-dying honour hath he got

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Against renowned Douglas! whose high deeds,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Whose hot incursions and great name in arms

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Holds from all soldiers chief majority

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: And military title capital

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Through all the kingdoms that acknowledge Christ:

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Thrice hath this Hotspur, Mars in swathling clothes,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: This infant warrior, in his enterprises

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Discomfited great Douglas, taen him once,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Enlarged him and made a friend of him,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: To fill the mouth of deep defiance up

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: And shake the peace and safety of our throne.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: And what say you to this? Percy, Northumberland,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: The Archbishops grace of York, Douglas, Mortimer,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Capitulate against us and are up.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: But wherefore do I tell these news to thee?

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Why, Harry, do I tell thee of my foes,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Which art my nearst and dearest enemy?

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Thou that art like enough, through vassal fear,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Base inclination and the start of spleen

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: To fight against me under Percys pay,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: To dog his heels and curtsy at his frowns,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: To show how much thou art degenerate.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Do not think so; you shall not find it so:

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: And God forgive them that so much have swayd

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Your majestys good thoughts away from me!

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: I will redeem all this on Percys head

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: And in the closing of some glorious day

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Be bold to tell you that I am your son;

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: When I will wear a garment all of blood

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: And stain my favours in a bloody mask,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Which, washd away, shall scour my shame with it:

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: And that shall be the day, wheneer it lights,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: That this same child of honour and renown,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: This gallant Hotspur, this all-praised knight,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: And your unthought-of Harry chance to meet.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: For every honour sitting on his helm,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Would they were multitudes, and on my head

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: My shames redoubled! for the time will come,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: That I shall make this northern youth exchange

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: His glorious deeds for my indignities.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Percy is but my factor, good my lord,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: To engross up glorious deeds on my behalf;

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: And I will call him to so strict account,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: That he shall render every glory up,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Yea, even the slightest worship of his time,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Or I will tear the reckoning from his heart.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: This, in the name of God, I promise here:

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: The which if He be pleased I shall perform,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: I do beseech your majesty may salve

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: The long-grown wounds of my intemperance:

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: If not, the end of life cancels all bands;

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: And I will die a hundred thousand deaths

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Ere break the smallest parcel of this vow.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: A hundred thousand rebels die in this:

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Thou shalt have charge and sovereign trust herein.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Enter BLUNT

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: How now, good Blunt? thy looks are full of speed.

speaker: SIR WALTER BLUNT
text_entry: So hath the business that I come to speak of.

speaker: SIR WALTER BLUNT
text_entry: Lord Mortimer of Scotland hath sent word

speaker: SIR WALTER BLUNT
text_entry: That Douglas and the English rebels met

speaker: SIR WALTER BLUNT
text_entry: The eleventh of this month at Shrewsbury

speaker: SIR WALTER BLUNT
text_entry: A mighty and a fearful head they are,

speaker: SIR WALTER BLUNT
text_entry: If promises be kept on every hand,

speaker: SIR WALTER BLUNT
text_entry: As ever offerd foul play in the state.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: The Earl of Westmoreland set forth to-day;

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: With him my son, Lord John of Lancaster;

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: For this advertisement is five days old:

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: On Wednesday next, Harry, you shall set forward;

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: On Thursday we ourselves will march: our meeting

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Is Bridgenorth: and, Harry, you shall march

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Through Gloucestershire; by which account,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Our business valued, some twelve days hence

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Our general forces at Bridgenorth shall meet.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Our hands are full of business: lets away;

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Advantage feeds him fat, while men delay.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Exeunt
Eastcheap. The Boars-Head Tavern.
Enter FALSTAFF and BARDOLPH

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Bardolph, am I not fallen away vilely since this last

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: action? do I not bate? do I not dwindle? Why my

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: skin hangs about me like an like an old ladys loose

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: gown; I am withered like an old apple-john. Well,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Ill repent, and that suddenly, while I am in some

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: liking; I shall be out of heart shortly, and then I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: shall have no strength to repent. An I have not

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: forgotten what the inside of a church is made of, I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: am a peppercorn, a brewers horse: the inside of a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: church! Company, villanous company, hath been the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: spoil of me.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: Sir John, you are so fretful, you cannot live long.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Why, there is it: come sing me a bawdy song; make

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: me merry. I was as virtuously given as a gentleman

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: need to be; virtuous enough; swore little; diced not

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: above seven times a week; went to a bawdy-house once

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: in a quarter--of an hour; paid money that I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: borrowed, three of four times; lived well and in

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: good compass: and now I live out of all order, out

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: of all compass.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: Why, you are so fat, Sir John, that you must needs

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: be out of all compass, out of all reasonable

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: compass, Sir John.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Do thou amend thy face, and Ill amend my life:

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: thou art our admiral, thou bearest the lantern in

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: the poop, but tis in the nose of thee; thou art the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Knight of the Burning Lamp.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: Why, Sir John, my face does you no harm.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: No, Ill be sworn; I make as good use of it as many

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: a man doth of a Deaths-head or a memento mori: I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: never see thy face but I think upon hell-fire and

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Dives that lived in purple; for there he is in his

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: robes, burning, burning. If thou wert any way

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: given to virtue, I would swear by thy face; my oath

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: should be By this fire, thats Gods angel: but

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: thou art altogether given over; and wert indeed, but

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: for the light in thy face, the son of utter

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: darkness. When thou rannest up Gadshill in the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: night to catch my horse, if I did not think thou

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: hadst been an ignis fatuus or a ball of wildfire,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: theres no purchase in money. O, thou art a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: perpetual triumph, an everlasting bonfire-light!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Thou hast saved me a thousand marks in links and

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: torches, walking with thee in the night betwixt

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: tavern and tavern: but the sack that thou hast

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: drunk me would have bought me lights as good cheap

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: at the dearest chandlers in Europe. I have

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: maintained that salamander of yours with fire any

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: time this two and thirty years; God reward me for

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: it!

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: Sblood, I would my face were in your belly!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: God-a-mercy! so should I be sure to be heart-burned.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Enter Hostess

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: How now, Dame Partlet the hen! have you inquired

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: yet who picked my pocket?

speaker: Hostess
text_entry: Why, Sir John, what do you think, Sir John? do you

speaker: Hostess
text_entry: think I keep thieves in my house? I have searched,

speaker: Hostess
text_entry: I have inquired, so has my husband, man by man, boy

speaker: Hostess
text_entry: by boy, servant by servant: the tithe of a hair

speaker: Hostess
text_entry: was never lost in my house before.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Ye lie, hostess: Bardolph was shaved and lost many

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: a hair; and Ill be sworn my pocket was picked. Go

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: to, you are a woman, go.

speaker: Hostess
text_entry: Who, I? no; I defy thee: Gods light, I was never

speaker: Hostess
text_entry: called so in mine own house before.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Go to, I know you well enough.

speaker: Hostess
text_entry: No, Sir John; You do not know me, Sir John. I know

speaker: Hostess
text_entry: you, Sir John: you owe me money, Sir John; and now

speaker: Hostess
text_entry: you pick a quarrel to beguile me of it: I bought

speaker: Hostess
text_entry: you a dozen of shirts to your back.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Dowlas, filthy dowlas: I have given them away to

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: bakers wives, and they have made bolters of them.

speaker: Hostess
text_entry: Now, as I am a true woman, holland of eight

speaker: Hostess
text_entry: shillings an ell. You owe money here besides, Sir

speaker: Hostess
text_entry: John, for your diet and by-drinkings, and money lent

speaker: Hostess
text_entry: you, four and twenty pound.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: He had his part of it; let him pay.

speaker: Hostess
text_entry: He? alas, he is poor; he hath nothing.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: How! poor? look upon his face; what call you rich?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: let them coin his nose, let them coin his cheeks:

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Ill not pay a denier. What, will you make a younker

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: of me? shall I not take mine case in mine inn but I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: shall have my pocket picked? I have lost a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: seal-ring of my grandfathers worth forty mark.

speaker: Hostess
text_entry: O Jesu, I have heard the prince tell him, I know not

speaker: Hostess
text_entry: how oft, that ring was copper!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: How! the prince is a Jack, a sneak-cup: sblood, an

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: he were here, I would cudgel him like a dog, if he

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: would say so.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Enter PRINCE HENRY and PETO, marching, and FALSTAFF meets them playing on his truncheon like a life

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: How now, lad! is the wind in that door, i faith?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: must we all march?

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: Yea, two and two, Newgate fashion.

speaker: Hostess
text_entry: My lord, I pray you, hear me.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: What sayest thou, Mistress Quickly? How doth thy

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: husband? I love him well; he is an honest man.

speaker: Hostess
text_entry: Good my lord, hear me.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Prithee, let her alone, and list to me.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: What sayest thou, Jack?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: The other night I fell asleep here behind the arras

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: and had my pocket picked: this house is turned

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: bawdy-house; they pick pockets.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: What didst thou lose, Jack?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Wilt thou believe me, Hal? three or four bonds of

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: forty pound apiece, and a seal-ring of my

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: grandfathers.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: A trifle, some eight-penny matter.

speaker: Hostess
text_entry: So I told him, my lord; and I said I heard your

speaker: Hostess
text_entry: grace say so: and, my lord, he speaks most vilely

speaker: Hostess
text_entry: of you, like a foul-mouthed man as he is; and said

speaker: Hostess
text_entry: he would cudgel you.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: What! he did not?

speaker: Hostess
text_entry: Theres neither faith, truth, nor womanhood in me else.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Theres no more faith in thee than in a stewed

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: prune; nor no more truth in thee than in a drawn

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: fox; and for womanhood, Maid Marian may be the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: deputys wife of the ward to thee. Go, you thing,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: go

speaker: Hostess
text_entry: Say, what thing? what thing?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: What thing! why, a thing to thank God on.

speaker: Hostess
text_entry: I am no thing to thank God on, I would thou

speaker: Hostess
text_entry: shouldst know it; I am an honest mans wife: and,

speaker: Hostess
text_entry: setting thy knighthood aside, thou art a knave to

speaker: Hostess
text_entry: call me so.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Setting thy womanhood aside, thou art a beast to say

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: otherwise.

speaker: Hostess
text_entry: Say, what beast, thou knave, thou?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: What beast! why, an otter.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: An otter, Sir John! Why an otter?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Why, shes neither fish nor flesh; a man knows not

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: where to have her.

speaker: Hostess
text_entry: Thou art an unjust man in saying so: thou or any

speaker: Hostess
text_entry: man knows where to have me, thou knave, thou!

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Thou sayest true, hostess; and he slanders thee most grossly.

speaker: Hostess
text_entry: So he doth you, my lord; and said this other day you

speaker: Hostess
text_entry: ought him a thousand pound.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Sirrah, do I owe you a thousand pound?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: A thousand pound, Ha! a million: thy love is worth

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: a million: thou owest me thy love.

speaker: Hostess
text_entry: Nay, my lord, he called you Jack, and said he would

speaker: Hostess
text_entry: cudgel you.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Did I, Bardolph?

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: Indeed, Sir John, you said so.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Yea, if he said my ring was copper.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: I say tis copper: darest thou be as good as thy word now?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Why, Hal, thou knowest, as thou art but man, I dare:

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: but as thou art prince, I fear thee as I fear the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: roaring of a lions whelp.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: And why not as the lion?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: The king is to be feared as the lion: dost thou

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: think Ill fear thee as I fear thy father? nay, an

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: I do, I pray God my girdle break.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: O, if it should, how would thy guts fall about thy

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: knees! But, sirrah, theres no room for faith,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: truth, nor honesty in this bosom of thine; it is all

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: filled up with guts and midriff. Charge an honest

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: woman with picking thy pocket! why, thou whoreson,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: impudent, embossed rascal, if there were anything in

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: thy pocket but tavern-reckonings, memorandums of

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: bawdy-houses, and one poor penny-worth of

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: sugar-candy to make thee long-winded, if thy pocket

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: were enriched with any other injuries but these, I

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: am a villain: and yet you will stand to if; you will

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: not pocket up wrong: art thou not ashamed?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Dost thou hear, Hal? thou knowest in the state of

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: innocency Adam fell; and what should poor Jack

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Falstaff do in the days of villany? Thou seest I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: have more flesh than another man, and therefore more

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: frailty. You confess then, you picked my pocket?

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: It appears so by the story.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Hostess, I forgive thee: go, make ready breakfast;

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: love thy husband, look to thy servants, cherish thy

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: guests: thou shalt find me tractable to any honest

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: reason: thou seest I am pacified still. Nay,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: prithee, be gone.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Exit Hostess

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Now Hal, to the news at court: for the robbery,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: lad, how is that answered?

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: O, my sweet beef, I must still be good angel to

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: thee: the money is paid back again.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: O, I do not like that paying back; tis a double labour.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: I am good friends with my father and may do any thing.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Rob me the exchequer the first thing thou doest, and

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: do it with unwashed hands too.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: Do, my lord.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: I have procured thee, Jack, a charge of foot.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: I would it had been of horse. Where shall I find

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: one that can steal well? O for a fine thief, of the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: age of two and twenty or thereabouts! I am

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: heinously unprovided. Well, God be thanked for

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: these rebels, they offend none but the virtuous: I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: laud them, I praise them.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Bardolph!

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: My lord?

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Go bear this letter to Lord John of Lancaster, to my

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: brother John; this to my Lord of Westmoreland.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Exit Bardolph

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Go, Peto, to horse, to horse; for thou and I have

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: thirty miles to ride yet ere dinner time.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Exit Peto

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Jack, meet me to-morrow in the temple hall at two

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: oclock in the afternoon.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: There shalt thou know thy charge; and there receive

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Money and order for their furniture.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: The land is burning; Percy stands on high;

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: And either we or they must lower lie.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Exit PRINCE HENRY

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Rare words! brave world! Hostess, my breakfast, come!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: O, I could wish this tavern were my drum!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Exit

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: ACT IV

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: SCENE I. The rebel camp near Shrewsbury.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Enter HOTSPUR, WORCESTER, and DOUGLAS

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Well said, my noble Scot: if speaking truth

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: In this fine age were not thought flattery,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Such attribution should the Douglas have,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: As not a soldier of this seasons stamp

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Should go so general current through the world.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: By God, I cannot flatter; I do defy

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: The tongues of soothers; but a braver place

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: In my hearts love hath no man than yourself:

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Nay, task me to my word; approve me, lord.

speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
text_entry: Thou art the king of honour:

speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
text_entry: No man so potent breathes upon the ground

speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
text_entry: But I will beard him.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Do so, and tis well.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Enter a Messenger with letters

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: What letters hast thou there?--I can but thank you.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: These letters come from your father.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Letters from him! why comes he not himself?

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: He cannot come, my lord; he is grievous sick.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Zounds! how has he the leisure to be sick

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: In such a rustling time? Who leads his power?

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Under whose government come they along?

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: His letters bear his mind, not I, my lord.

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: I prithee, tell me, doth he keep his bed?

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: He did, my lord, four days ere I set forth;

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: And at the time of my departure thence

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: He was much feard by his physicians.

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: I would the state of time had first been whole

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: Ere he by sickness had been visited:

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: His health was never better worth than now.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Sick now! droop now! this sickness doth infect

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: The very life-blood of our enterprise;

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Tis catching hither, even to our camp.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: He writes me here, that inward sickness--

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: And that his friends by deputation could not

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: So soon be drawn, nor did he think it meet

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: To lay so dangerous and dear a trust

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: On any soul removed but on his own.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Yet doth he give us bold advertisement,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: That with our small conjunction we should on,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: To see how fortune is disposed to us;

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: For, as he writes, there is no quailing now.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Because the king is certainly possessd

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Of all our purposes. What say you to it?

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: Your fathers sickness is a maim to us.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: A perilous gash, a very limb loppd off:

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: And yet, in faith, it is not; his present want

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Seems more than we shall find it: were it good

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: To set the exact wealth of all our states

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: All at one cast? to set so rich a main

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: On the nice hazard of one doubtful hour?

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: It were not good; for therein should we read

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: The very bottom and the soul of hope,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: The very list, the very utmost bound

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Of all our fortunes.

speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
text_entry: Faith, and so we should;

speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
text_entry: Where now remains a sweet reversion:

speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
text_entry: We may boldly spend upon the hope of what

speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
text_entry: Is to come in:

speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
text_entry: A comfort of retirement lives in this.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: A rendezvous, a home to fly unto.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: If that the devil and mischance look big

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Upon the maidenhead of our affairs.

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: But yet I would your father had been here.

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: The quality and hair of our attempt

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: Brooks no division: it will be thought

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: By some, that know not why he is away,

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: That wisdom, loyalty and mere dislike

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: Of our proceedings kept the earl from hence:

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: And think how such an apprehension

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: May turn the tide of fearful faction

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: And breed a kind of question in our cause;

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: For well you know we of the offering side

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: Must keep aloof from strict arbitrement,

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: And stop all sight-holes, every loop from whence

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: The eye of reason may pry in upon us:

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: This absence of your fathers draws a curtain,

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: That shows the ignorant a kind of fear

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: Before not dreamt of.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: You strain too far.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: I rather of his absence make this use:

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: It lends a lustre and more great opinion,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: A larger dare to our great enterprise,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Than if the earl were here; for men must think,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: If we without his help can make a head

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: To push against a kingdom, with his help

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: We shall oerturn it topsy-turvy down.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Yet all goes well, yet all our joints are whole.

speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
text_entry: As heart can think: there is not such a word

speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
text_entry: Spoke of in Scotland as this term of fear.

speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
text_entry: Enter SIR RICHARD VERNON

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: My cousin Vernon, welcome, by my soul.

speaker: VERNON
text_entry: Pray God my news be worth a welcome, lord.

speaker: VERNON
text_entry: The Earl of Westmoreland, seven thousand strong,

speaker: VERNON
text_entry: Is marching hitherwards; with him Prince John.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: No harm: what more?

speaker: VERNON
text_entry: And further, I have learnd,

speaker: VERNON
text_entry: The king himself in person is set forth,

speaker: VERNON
text_entry: Or hitherwards intended speedily,

speaker: VERNON
text_entry: With strong and mighty preparation.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: He shall be welcome too. Where is his son,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: The nimble-footed madcap Prince of Wales,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: And his comrades, that daffd the world aside,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: And bid it pass?

speaker: VERNON
text_entry: All furnishd, all in arms;

speaker: VERNON
text_entry: All plumed like estridges that with the wind

speaker: VERNON
text_entry: Baited like eagles having lately bathed;

speaker: VERNON
text_entry: Glittering in golden coats, like images;

speaker: VERNON
text_entry: As full of spirit as the month of May,

speaker: VERNON
text_entry: And gorgeous as the sun at midsummer;

speaker: VERNON
text_entry: Wanton as youthful goats, wild as young bulls.

speaker: VERNON
text_entry: I saw young Harry, with his beaver on,

speaker: VERNON
text_entry: His cuisses on his thighs, gallantly armd

speaker: VERNON
text_entry: Rise from the ground like featherd Mercury,

speaker: VERNON
text_entry: And vaulted with such ease into his seat,

speaker: VERNON
text_entry: As if an angel droppd down from the clouds,

speaker: VERNON
text_entry: To turn and wind a fiery Pegasus

speaker: VERNON
text_entry: And witch the world with noble horsemanship.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: No more, no more: worse than the sun in March,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: This praise doth nourish agues. Let them come:

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: They come like sacrifices in their trim,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: And to the fire-eyed maid of smoky war

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: All hot and bleeding will we offer them:

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: The mailed Mars shall on his altar sit

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Up to the ears in blood. I am on fire

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: To hear this rich reprisal is so nigh

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: And yet not ours. Come, let me taste my horse,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Who is to bear me like a thunderbolt

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Against the bosom of the Prince of Wales:

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Harry to Harry shall, hot horse to horse,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Meet and neer part till one drop down a corse.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: O that Glendower were come!

speaker: VERNON
text_entry: There is more news:

speaker: VERNON
text_entry: I learnd in Worcester, as I rode along,

speaker: VERNON
text_entry: He cannot draw his power this fourteen days.

speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
text_entry: Thats the worst tidings that I hear of yet.

speaker: WORCESTER
text_entry: Ay, by my faith, that bears a frosty sound.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: What may the kings whole battle reach unto?

speaker: VERNON
text_entry: To thirty thousand.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Forty let it be:

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: My father and Glendower being both away,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: The powers of us may serve so great a day

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Come, let us take a muster speedily:

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Doomsday is near; die all, die merrily.

speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
text_entry: Talk not of dying: I am out of fear

speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
text_entry: Of death or deaths hand for this one-half year.

speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
text_entry: SCENE II. A public road near Coventry.

speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
text_entry: Enter FALSTAFF and BARDOLPH

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Bardolph, get thee before to Coventry; fill me a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: bottle of sack: our soldiers shall march through;

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: well to Sutton Cofil tonight.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: Will you give me money, captain?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Lay out, lay out.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: This bottle makes an angel.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: An if it do, take it for thy labour; and if it make

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: twenty, take them all; Ill answer the coinage. Bid

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: my lieutenant Peto meet me at towns end.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: I will, captain: farewell.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: Exit

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: If I be not ashamed of my soldiers, I am a soused

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: gurnet. I have misused the kings press damnably.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: I have got, in exchange of a hundred and fifty

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: soldiers, three hundred and odd pounds. I press me

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: none but good house-holders, yeomans sons; inquire

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: me out contracted bachelors, such as had been asked

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: twice on the banns; such a commodity of warm slaves,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: as had as lieve hear the devil as a drum; such as

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: fear the report of a caliver worse than a struck

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: fowl or a hurt wild-duck. I pressed me none but such

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: toasts-and-butter, with hearts in their bellies no

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: bigger than pins heads, and they have bought out

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: their services; and now my whole charge consists of

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: ancients, corporals, lieutenants, gentlemen of

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: companies, slaves as ragged as Lazarus in the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: painted cloth, where the gluttons dogs licked his

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: sores; and such as indeed were never soldiers, but

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: discarded unjust serving-men, younger sons to

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: younger brothers, revolted tapsters and ostlers

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: trade-fallen, the cankers of a calm world and a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: long peace, ten times more dishonourable ragged than

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: an old faced ancient: and such have I, to fill up

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: the rooms of them that have bought out their

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: services, that you would think that I had a hundred

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: and fifty tattered prodigals lately come from

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: swine-keeping, from eating draff and husks. A mad

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: fellow met me on the way and told me I had unloaded

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: all the gibbets and pressed the dead bodies. No eye

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: hath seen such scarecrows. Ill not march through

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Coventry with them, thats flat: nay, and the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: villains march wide betwixt the legs, as if they had

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: gyves on; for indeed I had the most of them out of

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: prison. Theres but a shirt and a half in all my

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: company; and the half shirt is two napkins tacked

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: together and thrown over the shoulders like an

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: heralds coat without sleeves; and the shirt, to say

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: the truth, stolen from my host at Saint Albans, or

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: the red-nose innkeeper of Daventry. But thats all

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: one; theyll find linen enough on every hedge.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Enter the PRINCE and WESTMORELAND

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: How now, blown Jack! how now, quilt!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: What, Hal! how now, mad wag! what a devil dost thou

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: in Warwickshire? My good Lord of Westmoreland, I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: cry you mercy: I thought your honour had already been

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: at Shrewsbury.

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: Faith, Sir John,tis more than time that I were

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: there, and you too; but my powers are there already.

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: The king, I can tell you, looks for us all: we must

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: away all night.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Tut, never fear me: I am as vigilant as a cat to

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: steal cream.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: I think, to steal cream indeed, for thy theft hath

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: already made thee butter. But tell me, Jack, whose

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: fellows are these that come after?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Mine, Hal, mine.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: I did never see such pitiful rascals.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Tut, tut; good enough to toss; food for powder, food

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: for powder; theyll fill a pit as well as better:

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: tush, man, mortal men, mortal men.

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: Ay, but, Sir John, methinks they are exceeding poor

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: and bare, too beggarly.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Faith, for their poverty, I know not where they had

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: that; and for their bareness, I am sure they never

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: learned that of me.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: No Ill be sworn; unless you call three fingers on

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: the ribs bare. But, sirrah, make haste: Percy is

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: already in the field.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: What, is the king encamped?

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: He is, Sir John: I fear we shall stay too long.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Well,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: To the latter end of a fray and the beginning of a feast

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Fits a dull fighter and a keen guest.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: SCENE III. The rebel camp near Shrewsbury.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Enter HOTSPUR, WORCESTER, DOUGLAS, and VERNON

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Well fight with him to-night.

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: It may not be.

speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
text_entry: You give him then the advantage.

speaker: VERNON
text_entry: Not a whit.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Why say you so? looks he not for supply?

speaker: VERNON
text_entry: So do we.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: His is certain, ours is doubtful.

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: Good cousin, be advised; stir not tonight.

speaker: VERNON
text_entry: Do not, my lord.

speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
text_entry: You do not counsel well:

speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
text_entry: You speak it out of fear and cold heart.

speaker: VERNON
text_entry: Do me no slander, Douglas: by my life,

speaker: VERNON
text_entry: And I dare well maintain it with my life,

speaker: VERNON
text_entry: If well-respected honour bid me on,

speaker: VERNON
text_entry: I hold as little counsel with weak fear

speaker: VERNON
text_entry: As you, my lord, or any Scot that this day lives:

speaker: VERNON
text_entry: Let it be seen to-morrow in the battle

speaker: VERNON
text_entry: Which of us fears.

speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
text_entry: Yea, or to-night.

speaker: VERNON
text_entry: Content.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: To-night, say I.

speaker: VERNON
text_entry: Come, come it nay not be. I wonder much,

speaker: VERNON
text_entry: Being men of such great leading as you are,

speaker: VERNON
text_entry: That you foresee not what impediments

speaker: VERNON
text_entry: Drag back our expedition: certain horse

speaker: VERNON
